stimulusHtml: Which of the following changes to the demonstration would increase the angular acceleration of the disk?

features.html: In a laboratory demonstration, a constant force is exerted on a uniform disk tangent to the diskâ€™s edge. The disk rotates about an axle through its center with negligible friction.

choicesHtml: Replacing the original disk with a ring that has the same mass and radius as the disk.
Replacing the original disk with a disk that has the same mass and radius but has a density that decreases radially from its center.
Replacing the original disk with a disk that has twice the radius but the same mass as the original disk.
Exerting the force perpendicular to the edge of the disk rather than tangent to the edge.
